intro: Lysiosepalum abollatum, commonly known as the desert star, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, displaying drought tolerance and minimal water requirements. Lysiosepalum abollatum is often used in xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and aesthetic appeal.
